title: Transfer Credits and Military Transcripts  · Angelo State University
description: Discover how Angelo State supports active duty and veteran students by transferring military credits for a seamless transition to academic programs.

headings: Community College of the Air Force (CCAF)
Additional Elective Credits through House Bill 269
paragraphs: If you are requesting military and college/university transcripts to be sent to Angelo State, please use the following contact information:
Angelo State UniversityOffice of AdmissionsASU Station #11014San Angelo, TX 76909-1014admissions@angelo.edu

The JST is the official transcript for Army, Marine Corps, Navy and Coast Guard personnel. It validates and documents the American Council on Education (ACE) recommended college credits for professional military education, training courses and occupational experience of service members and veterans.
Many military students receive ASU transfer credit from their JST. Pleaserequest your JSTto be sent to Angelo State for review.
CCAF transcripts show courses/training provided through the Air Force. Many courses from CCAF transfer to ASU. Pleaserequest your CCAF transcriptto be sent to Angelo State for review.

Some NCS courses are shown on a Joint Services Transcript. However, some NCS courses have not been evaluated by ACE to appear on a JST. ASU will review NCS transcripts to determine if additional credits can be awarded that are not already listed on the JST. See the NCS Agreement information in the Special Military Programs section below for more information.
Contact the NSA to have a transcript of your completed courses sent to Angelo State.

You may receive college transfer credit for credits earned through exams like the College Level Examination Program (CLEP) general and subject examinations, as well as the Defense Activity for Non-Traditional Education Support (DANTES) Subject Standardized Tests (DSST exams). The list of tests accepted and the equivalent credit earned forDSST can be found hereand the ones forCLEP can be found here.
CLEP and DANTES tests may be taken at any approved site. The CLEP can be taken through theASU Testing Center.

Texas House Bill 269 allows military veterans who enroll in Texas universities and meet certain requirements eligible to receive undergraduate credit for the time they spent in the service for up to 12 credit hours of elective course work.
Not all students need elective credits. Please read theinformationregarding the optional electives and consult with your academic advisor.

ASU is a partner institution in the College Credit for Heroes program administered by the Texas Workforce Commission. As the only four-year institution currently serving as a partner school, we are honored to be a part of the program. The program seeks to maximize college credit awarded to veterans and service members for their military experience, ultimately resulting in those students receiving their degrees more quickly.
